candidates.title: Remap, Rmp, RFrom
candidates.body: This is more complex and flexible replacement for #462 with API similar to f4xx-hal.

candidates.title: Use latest version of `usb-device` and `usbd-serial`
candidates.body: Use the latest version to get implementations of `Read` and `Write` from `embedded-io` for `SerialPort`.

candidates.title: support both e-hal 0.2 & 1.0
candidates.body: Some impls in `spi` & `i2c` are marked with `todo!`

candidates.title: Use modify instead of write for clearing sr1
candidates.body:
As per the discussion in #282 

This seems better, but it also leaves the possibility of some flags not being cleared if multiple flags are raised at the same time. Is that something that can even happen, and how should we deal with it then?

CC: @Disasm

repo.name: stm32f1xx-hal
repo.description: A Rust embedded-hal HAL impl for the STM32F1 family based on japarics stm32f103xx-hal
